question_sentence: Which British cyclist won their 19th Paralympic gold medal in Paris?
evidence: Storey's dominance of the cycling events is all the more impressive given that she began her sporting career as a swimmer, winning five of her Paralympic golds in the pool before switching to cycling for the 2008 Games.

question_sentence: A former aide to the governor of New York has been charged with being an unregistered agent of which country?
evidence: Linda Sun and her husband, Christopher Hu, were both arrested and charged on Tuesday with money laundering, bank fraud and other crimes. Sun is accused of using her roles within New York's government, including as an aide to Governor Kathy Hochul, to "further the interests of the Chinese government".

question_sentence: Which US car manufacturer announced plans to scale back its diversity schemes?
evidence: The carmaker's CEO, Jim Farley, told staff in an email that the company was scaling back several DEI schemes, but insisted it would remain an "inclusive workspace". Several US-based companies have made similar moves in response to pressure from conservative activists as well as an increase in legal challenges to "affirmative action" policies.

question_sentence: Two Russian missiles struck a military academy and hospital in which Ukrainian city?
evidence: The morning strike on Poltava claimed 51 lives and injured over 270, making it the deadliest single attack in Ukraine this year. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has pleaded on social media for international aid to provide air defence systems and missiles as Ukraine continues to face Russian bombardment.

question_sentence: Pedro Almodóvar’s "The Room Next Door" received the longest standing ovation so far at this year's Venice Film Festival. How long did it last?
evidence: The mammoth applause session following the screening of the Spanish director's latest film has sparked conversation around whether the standing ovation has lost its punch. Prolonged clapping has become a feature of film festivals, to the point where an ovation that lasts for "only" a few minutes is widely seen as a sign of a flop.

question_sentence: The US seized Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro's jet after it landed in Florida from which other country?
evidence: The U.S. Justice Department revealed that Nicolás Maduro's Dassault Falcon 900EX was bought by a shell company in violation of U.S. sanctions and smuggled out of the States. It is one of many jets seized from Venezuelan leaders for alleged drug trafficking or corruption.

question_sentence: Who became the first candidate eliminated from the race to succeed Rishi Sunak as leader of the Conservative Party?
evidence: Robert Jenrick, the former immigration minister, topped the first round of voting, pushing bookies' favourite Kemi Badenoch into second place. A second round next week will eliminate another contender, with MPs then choosing two final candidates to go head to head for the votes of the party membership.

question_sentence: Pope Francis and Grand Imam Nasaruddin Umar signed a joint declaration urging action on climate change and religious intolerance at which landmark?
evidence: Pope Francis met religious leaders at Jakarta's Istiqlal Mosque, urging action against climate change and religious intolerance. He will leave Indonesia on Friday for Papua New Guinea, continuing his 12-day journey through Southeast Asia and Oceania.

question_sentence: Acclaimed Australian sitcom "Colin from Accounts" returned to screens for a second season – but what is the titular Colin?
evidence: A border terrier, to be precise, who brought together friends-to-lovers couple Ash and Gordon in season one of the critical hit. Reviews of season two have been just as glowing, praising the show's combination of comedy and realism.

question_sentence: Thai officials revealed that 1.3 million kilos of what invasive fish have been eradicated from the country's waterways since February?
evidence: Fast-breeding blackchin tilapia have flooded Thailand's waterways, wreaking havoc on the country's fish and shrimp farming sector. Plans to eliminate the invasive species include paying bounties to encourage fishing and developing a sterile tilapia.

question_sentence: Travel experts say which season is the best time of year to take a trip?
evidence: Experts say fall is the best time to travel. Crowds thin out, prices in some destinations come down from peak season rates and airfares drop significantly.

question_sentence: The US Justice Department seized which of the following that belonged to Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro?
evidence: The DOJ seized Maduro’s airplane in the Dominican Republic after determining that its acquisition violated US sanctions, among other criminal issues.

question_sentence: How many hot dogs and buns did competitive eating champ Joey Chestnut devour during a Labor Day contest on Netflix?
evidence: Chestnut devoured 83 all-beef hot dogs and buns in 10 minutes, beating his own record of 76 set three years ago.

question_sentence: Which company recently hiked membership fees for the first time in 7 years?
evidence: Costco announced in July that membership fees would increase by $5 to $65 a year in the US and Canada for three of its plans. The changes started for new members signing up on or after September 1 and renewals occurring after that date.

question_sentence: The Biden administration announced a sweeping set of actions this week to tackle a major effort to influence the 2024 US presidential election by which country?
evidence: In the most significant public response yet to alleged Russian influence operations targeting American voters, the Biden administration unveiled criminal charges against two Russian nationals, sanctions on 10 individuals and entities and the seizure of 32 internet domains.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court justice published a new memoir this week?
evidence: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson’s new memoir, “Lovely One,” reflects on a personal journey that has already earned her a place in history as the first Black woman to serve on the high court. The book’s title is a reference to Jackson’s name in an African dialect.

question_sentence: A widespread strike by union workers affected which type of business during the busy Labor Day weekend?
evidence: More than 10,000 hotel workers at 24 hotels stretching from Boston to the West Coast to Hawaii went on strike, disrupting travel during the long holiday weekend.

question_sentence: US regulators want to investigate which two companies for selling “deadly” baby products?
evidence: Shein and Temu, two Chinese low-cost e-commerce websites, are the target of a proposed investigation by the US government for selling “deadly baby and toddler products.”

question_sentence: Skywatchers in the Philippines caught a glimpse of which phenomenon this week?
evidence: A roughly 3-foot asteroid burned up in Earth’s atmosphere over the Philippines near Luzon Island on Wednesday, according to NASA. The object was harmless.

question_sentence: Which restaurant chain is launching its first Halloween costume collection?
evidence: Chipotle this week announced a costume collection with Spirit Halloween, the seasonal store that pops up every year in abandoned storefronts. The collection is made up of bodysuits that are meant to resemble a Chipotle napkin, fork, water cup, burrito and to-go bag.

question_sentence: What was the outcome of the incident at The Summit retirement community in Delaware?
choices: A resident was critically injured in an attack by another resident.
A resident was killed in an attack by another resident.
A resident was injured in a fall.
A resident was found unresponsive due to natural causes.

question_sentence: Who is the house band for the Delaware Rock & Roll Hall of Fame 2024 induction ceremony?
According to the study analyzing government data from 2017 to 2021, which state had the highest rate of pedestrian fatalities?
What job did Bob Marley hold while living in Wilmington, Delaware, that influenced the lyrics of his song “Night Shift”?
What new security measure is Cape Henlopen School District implementing at their football games starting September 20th?
What is one reason Sleeping Bird Doughnuts in Delaware has become so popular?
choices: They offer a wide variety of gluten-free doughnuts.
They are made with sweet and buttery brioche dough, a rarity in the area.
They are open 24 hours a day.
They offer free doughnuts to the first 100 customers every day.

question_sentence: Which city is considered the oldest European settlement in Delaware?
When is the new Target store in Middletown, Delaware, expected to open?
Where is the new Verizon cell tower in Hockessin being constructed?
choices: Near the Hockessin Police Athletic League

question_sentence: What is one of the main reasons for the increase in vehicle thefts in Delaware?
